Very nice software. Very good for teaching since it is free to use.

SciLab has been one of my favorite FREE open source computation, numerical calculations, plotting and graphing since over a decade ago using Mathematica student version. SciLab is FREE (as in beer) and does most of what Mathematica, Matlab and Maple does. 

*** Caveat: You need to manually install latest Java JDK for LInux (openjdk) in the terminal:

"sudo apt install openjdk-17-jdk" without the quotes, of course. ;)

You can always search for the latest Jave (Open) JDK with:

"sudo apt search openjdk"

If your first run errors with a "missing canberra-gtk-module, blah, blah.." then do this in the terminal as well:

"sudo apt install libcanberra-gtk-module"

Enjoy!!
summary: AWESOME numerical computation program BUT Install Java/OpenJDK first!!

description:
Unfortunately since version 6.02 there is an issue when you create new inputs/outputs in a user defined block: the numbering doesn't increment so you have to update them manually. For a few inputs it's ok. But if you have a lot of blocks and more than 20 inputs/outputs it is really inefficient. On version 5.5.2 the port numbering works correctly. 

The development seems to have stopped since version 6.1.1 from July 2021. Too bad!
